intro: Calpurnia lasiogyne, commonly known as the Indian flame of the woods, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with small, rounded leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
